title: Poor and a waste of time

Granted it was free but it's a complete waste of time. This is from someone who is tech savvy. You're obviously ignorant. The review /opinion will help others NOT waste their time.

Hi Michael,

First of all, I don't see the need to attack everyone in the reviews section.
Second, mind saying what the problem was?

Reply to edit: How would I create a better app when you don't say what doesn't work...
I don't care if you're the CEO of a multi million company, your review isn't helpful to anyone.

Regards,
Mohammad Abu-Garbeyyeh

title: Beaming done right.
comment: Forget about installing apps on the receiving end. This app simply just works, as it should. Uses the stock Android beam protocol, rather than a proprietary one. Fast, reliable, and easy to use.

title: Fantastic app

title: Amazing!
comment: Does exactly what it says!

title: Good start...
comment: ...if it used WiFi direct would be even better. Maybe a setting as to whether to use WD or BT for the actual transfer?

Hi Matt,

Unfortunately this isn't possible. The application doesn't interact with Bluetooth itself at all (as you can see, it doesn't ask for permission to use Bluetooth), it only instructs Android to send "this file" using Android Beam, and Android handles the rest.

Regards,
Mohammad Abu-Garbeyyeh

title: Much Needed NFC's Extensibility
comment: This is like an important limb of NFC, aside from its limited capability of NFC payment and multimedia file sharing.  The app to share any kind of file via NFC, beats having to rename file or doing it via BT manually.  Will rate 5 stars if it supports multiple files shares as opposed to only 1 right now. I could NFC few images from Gallery, why not this?  Good stuff!

Hi,

Sending multiple files was added in v1.1 :)

Regards,
Mohammad Abu-Garbeyyeh
